q1.summary: This documentation explains how to manage Amazon S3 buckets, including viewing properties, enabling versioning, and using the AWS CLI to create buckets. It also highlights tagging for cost allocation and provides a code snippet for determining a bucket's region.
This documentation provides instructions and code examples for creating an Amazon S3 bucket using AWS SDKs for PHP and Python, including error handling and configuration details.

It also covers lifecycle management and pricing considerations for transitioning data between storage classes.

Querying data in place with Amazon S3 Select
Important
Amazon S3 Select is no longer available to new customers. Existing customers of Amazon
S3 Select can continue to use the feature as usual. Learn ...
q4.summary: Amazon S3 Select allows existing customers to query and filter data from S3 objects using SQL, reducing data transfer costs and latency. It supports CSV, JSON, and Apache Parquet formats but is no longer available to new customers.

q4.text:
SQL reference for Amazon S3 Select
Important
Amazon S3 Select is no longer available to new customers. Existing customers of Amazon
S3 Select can continue to use the feature as usual. Learn more
This ...
q4.summary: This documentation provides an overview of the SQL elements supported by Amazon S3 Select, including the SELECT command and its supported clauses. Note that Amazon S3 Select is no longer available to new customers.

q4.text:
Learn more
Amazon S3 Select supports the following operators. Logical operators
• AND
• NOT
• OR
Comparison operators
• <
• >
• <=
• >=
• =
• <>
• !=
• BETWEEN
• IN – For example: IN ('a', 'b', 'c')
P...
q4.summary: This documentation provides a reference for Amazon S3 Select's supported SQL operators, reserved keywords, and their precedence, along with a list of SQL functions and usage notes.
